document.masterDocTitle: A Contribution To The Knowledge Of Sweltsa Exquisita (Frison) And S. Occidens (Frison) And Description Of A New Species Of Sweltsa From The Northern Rocky Mountains, U. S. A. (Plecoptera: Chloroperlidae)

caption.paragraph:
Figs. 10-17.
Sweltsa occidens
, male terminalia and aedeagus. 10. male terminalia, dorsal, St. Andrews Creek, Washington; 11. epiproct apex, dorsal, St. Andrews Creek, Washington; 12. epiproct, lateral, St. Andrews Creek, Washington; 13. epiproct apex, lateral, St. Andrews Creek, Washington; 14. aedeagus and epiproct, lateral, St. Andrews Creek, Washington; 15. aedeagus, terminal, St. Andrews Creek, Washington; 16. aedeagus, apex expanded, dorsal, Big Face Creek, Washington; 17. spine patch, aedeagus, dorsal, below apex, Big Face Creek, Washington.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female. Color and markings similar to male. Subgenital plate subtriangular and not covering all of sternum 9, apex more narrowly rounded, often exhibiting a shallow emarginate area at the tip, but the posterior margin is usually entire ( Fig. 27 ) for
S. durfeei
.
